summary:
The BMW M54 engine was produced from 2000 to 2006 and was phased out in 2004 with the introduction of the BMW N52. It features a straight-six configuration with displacements of 2.5L, 2.5L, and 3.0L, and was recognized on Ward's 10 Best Engines list from 2001 to 2003. The M54's predecessor was the BMW M52, and its successor is the BMW N52. 

The BMW S54 engine, produced from 2000 to 2008, is also a straight-six engine with a displacement of 3.2L. It has a cast iron block and an aluminum head, and it succeeded the BMW S50 while paving the way for the BMW S55.
